body_content.explanation: a tool or device for cutting something:
examples: Slide the frittata out of the pan and slice it with a pizza cutter.
This cutter has a six-inch blade.
His woodworking shop is full of power tools, blades, bits, and cutters.

body_content.explanation: a person, especially a worker, who cuts something:
examples: The exploitation of sugar cane cutters in Haiti is well known.
He worked at the meat plant for 35 years as a cutter.

body_content.explanation: a person whose job is to cut cloth for making clothes:
examples: To succeed in this business, you need a good dress designer and a good cutter.
All of the stylists in this salon are expert cutters.

body_content.explanation: someone or something that reduces a tax, a cost, etc.:
examples: The candidate highlighted his record as a tax cutter.
Many of these changes are potential cost cutters.

body_content.explanation: a fast, light boat, used for example as a patrol boat (= checking an area for crime or danger) or for carrying small loads:
examples: When the ship reached the American coast it was greeted by a US coastguard cutter.
A little white cutter with red sails was coming in towards them.

body_content.explanation: in cricket, a throw in which the ball suddenly changes direction after it hits the ground:
examples: He was a great slow wicket bowler, famous for bowling cutters.

body_content.explanation: in baseball, a hard throw in which the ball moves slightly as it reaches the batter (= the player who tries to hit the ball):
examples: His cutter has become a devastating weapon.
The hitter swung and missed at a cutter.
